feat.name: Armor Specialist
entries: You have studied the use of armor, and have improved your ability to use armor effectively.

items.name: Armored Agility
entries: When you wear medium armor you are proficient in, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

items.name: Armor Mastery
entries: While you are wielding a shield, wearing medium heavy or heavy armor you are proficient in, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical weapons is reduced by your proficiency bonus. If you are wielding a magical shield, wearing magical medium armor or magical heavy armor (of any type) damage reduction applies to all bludgeoning, piercing or slashing weapons.

items.name: Armored Stealth
entries: Wearing medium or heavy armor which you are proficient in doesn't impose disadvantage on your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

items.name: Heavy Armor Mobility
entries: You may ignore the minimum Strength requirement of heavy armor you are proficient in.

items.name: Heavy Armor Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in heavy armor (you must be proficient in medium armor from a source other than this feat to choose this feature).

items.name: Light Armor Defense
entries: While wearing light armor, you may add your armor's AC bonus to your Dexterity saving throws.

items.name: Light Armor Mastery
entries: While wearing light armor which you are proficient in, and you are damaged by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to move 5 feet in any direction without provoking an opportunity attack.

items.name: Light Armor Mobility
entries: While wearing light armor, opportunity attacks are made against you with disadvantage.

items.name: Light Armor Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in light armor.

items.name: Light Armor Versatility
entries: You may wear a {@item chain shirt|phb} or {@item hide armor|phb} as light armor for the sake of determining proficiency. When wearing a {@item chain shirt|phb} or {@item hide armor|phb}, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

items.name: Medium Armor Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in medium armor (you must be proficient in light armor through a source other than this feat to choose this feature).

items.name: Shield Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in shields.

items.name: Quick Guard
entries: You can don and doff a shield as a bonus action.

feat.name: Battle Magic

prerequisite.other: the ability to cast at least one spell

entries: Your magic has been honed to use in combat, your quick thinking and specialized training provide certain advantages while fighting with spells.

items.name: Battlecaster
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to {@action cast a spell} at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

items.name: Elemental Adept
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder. Spells you cast ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type. You may select this feature more than once with your three selections, if you do so you choose a different damage type. Alternatively, if you select this feature a second time, creatures with immunity to the damage type selected with a previous selection of this feature may be damaged as if they had resistance instead.

items.name: Hardy Concentration
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.

items.name: Mystical Sharpshooter
entries: Up to once on your turn, before you make a ranged spell attack, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage.

items.name: Reliable Spells
entries: When you roll damage for a spell you cast, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

items.name: Spell Accuracy
entries: Your ranged spell attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

items.name: Spell Sniper
entries: When you cast a spell that requires you to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled.

items.name: Warcaster
entries: You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

items.name: Elemental Adept
entries: to have invuln treated as resist baked in?

items.name: Mystical Sharpshooter
entries: to not be only ranged spells, but any spell attack roll; change name to ???

items.name: Spell Accuracy
entries: to do all spells, not just ranged spell attack rolls

items.name: Reliable Spells
entries: 2nd pointers, treat any 1 on damage die as max instead

items.name: Overload Magic
entries: Creatures that roll a natural 1 on a saving throw against a spell you cast and take damage, the damage received is doubled

items.name: ?? (from Metamagic Adept)
entries: You learn one Metamagic option of your choice from the sorcerer class.  You gain 1 sorcery point to spend on Metamagic (these points are added to any sorcery points you have from another source but can only be used on Metamagic).  You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.  Whenevery you gain a level, you can replace one of these Metamagic options with another one from the sorcerer class.  If you select this feature a second time, you gain another Metamagic option and another sorcery point.

feat.name: Combat Reflexes
entries: You are especially quick and nimble, and this provides you with benefits in your movement and reactions

items.name: Alert
entries: You cannot be surprised while you are conscious.

items.name: Combat Mobility
entries: You may take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.  If you select this feature a second time, your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from creatures you can see.

items.name: Fast Reflexes
entries: You gain a bonus to initiative equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Fleet
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet.

items.name: Light Footed
entries: Difficult terrain does not cost you extra movement.

items.name: Nimble
entries: When you are {@condition prone}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.  Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement, and you can make a running long or high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

items.name: Uncanny Senses
entries: Other creatures do not gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.
When you hit with an attack of opportunity and it would have hit without your proficiency bonus, the attack of opportunity does not use your reaction
Ranged attacks made from XX feet away from you are done at disadvantage
You can use your Dexterity in place of Strength with climbing and jumping
You do not require a running start to jump max distances
Taking fall damage does not knock you {@condition prone}, unless you wish to

feat.name: Dual Weapon Specialist
entries: You are a master of fighting with two weapons at once.  Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing two weapon fighting.

items.name: Bonus Attacks
entries: You may use your bonus action to make an attack with a weapon you are holding on your turn as long as you made a weapon attack with a different weapon you are holding, even if you didn't take the {@action Attack} action.

items.name: Defensive Dual Wielder
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.

items.name: Heavy Dual Wielder
entries: You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding are not light.

items.name: Multi Attacker
entries: When you use a bonus action to attack using two-weapon fighting, you may make an additional attack with that weapon if you made more than one attack with another weapon you are holding on that turn.

items.name: Quick Dual Wielding
entries: Whenever you use your {@action Use an Object} action to draw or stow a weapon, you may do so with two one-handed weapons at the same time.  If you select this feature a second time, you may also stow an object you are holding as part of the same interaction.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in three one-handed weapons of your choice.

When you make an attack of opportunity with a weapon you are holding, you can make another weapon attack with another weapon you are holding as part of the same of attack of opportunity against the same target.  2 points to allow the additional attack be against anyone within weapon's reach.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: 2 points expands your crit range with one handed weapons you attack with that you are prof with by 1 while wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand

feat.name: Educated
entries: You have studied with a capable teacher, or at a college, perhaps learning lore, languages, or perhaps learning other skills through a mentor.

items.name: Coder
entries: You can ably create written ciphers.  Ohters can't decipher a code you create unless you teach them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC equal to your Intelligence score + your proficiency bonus) or they use magic to decipher it.  Your spellbook, if you have one, may be written in such ciphers preventing it from being copied by anyone who you have not taught the cipher to.

items.name: Expert Education
entries: Gain expertise in a skill or tool for which you are proficient.

items.name: Linguist
entries: You learn three languages of your choice.  Your understanding of communication allows you to communicate with a creature who speaks a language you don't know on a rudimentary level after 10 minutes of interaction.  In addition, you may decipher a written language you don't know on a rudimentary level after 10 minutes of study.

items.name: Skill Training
entries: Gain proficiency in a skill in which you are not proficient.  This feature may be selected more than once.

items.name: Studied
entries: You gain advantage on any Intelligence ability check to recall information about a type of creature.

items.name: Tool Training
entries: Gain proficiency in three sets of tools for which you are not proficient.  You may add half your proficiency modifier on any ability check to use a set of tools for which you are not proficient.

items.name: Keen Skill
entries: Expend a hit dice to reroll skills you are proficient in or have expertise.  2 points to be all skill.

When you take the {@action Help} action to aid an ally by distracting an enemy, you can also choose to distract any number of additional creatures within 5 feet of the target, giving the chosen ally advantage on attack rolls against each of the affected creatures.
When you take the {@action Use an Object} action, you can interact with one additional object.
If you make an ability check at advantage you instead roll 3 dice and take the highest
You learn to read and write 3 languages of your chocie, and if you spend 1 minute or more examining a mundane or magical script, you can determine the language in which it is written.

feat.name: Fey Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, granting you a broad array of potential benefits

items.name: ??. (from Fey Touched, reworked)
entries: You learn the {@spell misty step} spell.  You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot.  Once you cast it in this way, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.  you can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.  The spell's spellcasting ability is your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

feat.name: Gifts of the Dragon
entries: You have manifested some of the power of the awe-inspiring and frightening dragons, granting you a broad array of potential benefits

items.name: Chromatic Infusion
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.  For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits.  After you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Protective Wings
entries: You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others.  When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment.  You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss.  You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Reactive Resistance
entries: When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to that instance of damage.  You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Magical Training
entries: You have learned the basics of magic, either through a teacher, or your own initiative.  This has given you rudimentary magic skills and/or the training to deal with spellcasters.

items.name: Hedge Magic
entries: Choose 2 cantrips from any one spell list.  You may cast those cantrips using the same ability score as the class from which you chose the cantrips.  You may select this feature more than once.

items.name: Mage Slayer
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.  If you select this feature a second time and the attack hits, the spell is lost.

items.name: Magical Adept
entries: Choose one 1st-level spell from any spell list.  You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest level.  Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again using this feat.  You use the same ability score as the class from which list you chose the spell.  You may select this feature more than once.

items.name: Ritual Book
entries: You have learned to cast wizard rituals from a ritual book that you possess. if you come across a wizard spell in written form, such as a magical spell scroll or spellbook, you might be able to add it to your ritual book. The spell must be no higher than half your level (rounded up), and it must have the ritual tag. The process of copying the spell into your ritual book takes 2 hours per level of the spell, and costs 50 gp per level. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

If you select this feature a second time, you may select another ritual casting class and may add their ritual spells to your ritual book. The spellcasting ability used for these rituals matches the class for which the rituals belong.

items.name: Ritual Caster
entries: You gain the ability to cast 2 1st-level spells of your choice as a ritual. Choose one of the following classes: bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard. You must choose your spells from that class's spell list, and the spells you choose must have the ritual tag. The class you choose also determines your spellcasting ability for these spells: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.
If you select this feature a second time, you may also select a 2nd level ritual spell from the same class that you may cast as a ritual.

items.name: Spell Interruption
entries: When you damage a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its constitution.

items.name: Universal Spell Focus
entries: If you have the Spellcasting Focus feature from a class you have levels in, that spellcasting focus becomes an applicable focus for all spells from any class.
creatures you grapple are unable to perform somatic components to their spells and must make concentration checks DC equal to your successful grapple check (minimum of 10)

items.name: ?? (from Artificer Initiate)
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast.

items.name: ?? (from Eldritch Adept)
entries: You learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the warlock class. If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you're a warlock who meets the prerequisite. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.
Whenever you use a wonderous item with its own save DC you may substitute it with your own spell DC

feat.name: Mounted Combat Specialist
entries: You are a master of fighting while mounted. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when fighting on horseback or another applicable mount.

items.name: Cavalry Attack
entries: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount. If you select this feature a second time, you also have advantage against unmounted creatures of equal size to your mount.

items.name: Durable Mount
entries: If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It may use your saving throw modifier if it is higher. If you select this feature a second time, your mount gains the same benefit against effects that allow it to make a Constitution saving throw.

items.name: Lance Charge
entries: If your mount moves at least 10 feet towards an enemy on your turn and you use the attack action to attack that enemy with a lance, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you hit with your initial attack and have the extra attack feature, you may forgo your second attack and the hit is considered a critical hit and the enemy is knocked {@condition prone} if they are no larger than your mount.

items.name: Mounted Combat Mastery
entries: If your mount is controlled, it is not restricted in the actions you can have it make. (normally a controlled mount is restricted to the Dodge, Dash or Disengage actions). If you select this feature a second time, you may control a mount even if it is not trained for combat.

items.name: Mount Defender
entries: You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead. If you select this feature a second time, that attack is made with disadvantage.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in the Lance, and two other martial weapons of your choice.
When you spend an hour or more with your mount during a short or long rest, your mount gains temp hp equal to your level + your prof bonus.

You can use Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) instead of Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) to stabilize your mount that has been reduced to 0 hp. Your prof is like dwarven stonecunning. If you succeed on the check, the beast then regains 1 hit point and can spend a number of hit die equal to your prof bonus to further regain hit points.
Whenever your mount is below half health, it can use its bonus action to spend a hit dice to heal.
Your mount's attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

items.name: ?? (from Telepathic)
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

items.name: ?? (from Telepathic)
entries: You can cast the detect thoughts spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

items.name: Telekinetic Reprisal. (from Gift of the Gem Dragon)
entries: When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to emanate telekinetic energy. The creature that dealt damage to you must make a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat). On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isnâ€™t pushed. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Ranged Combat Specialist
entries: You are a master in the art of ranged attacks in combat. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when using weapons that attack at range.

items.name: Deadly Aim
entries: Before you make a ranged attack with a weapon that you are proficient in and holding with two hands, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you select this feature a second time, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your proficiency modifier to the attack roll, adding twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

items.name: Fast Firing
entries: When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one handed ranged weapon or thrown weapon that you are holding or may draw as part of the bonus action.

items.name: Fast Loader
entries: You ignore the loading property of ranged weapons with which you are proficient.

items.name: Fast Thrower
entries: You may draw weapons with the thrown property as part of the attack with that weapon.

items.name: Long Range Sniper
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls and your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover. If you select this feature a second time, you may attack with your weapon up to twice the weapons maximum range, attacks over the maximum range of the weapon impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

items.name: Point Blank Shot
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesnâ€™t impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in three ranged weapons or weapons with the thrown property.
For 2 points you expand your crit range by 1 with ranged weapons or weapons with the thrown property

items.name: Fletcher
entries: You gain proficiency with woodcarver's tools if you don't already have it. Additionally, when you finish a long rest, you can create special ammunition provided you have the materials and your woodcarver's tolls available. You craft a number of ammunition eqaul to your proficiency bonus, which last 8 hours after being made. A creature hit by this ammunition takes additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
You gain proficiency with firearms (see Firearms in the Dungeon Master's Guide)

feat.name: Savage Combatant
entries: You are a crazed attacker on the battlefield. Your bloodlust has granted you certain advantages while fighting with unmatched zeal.

items.name: Athlete
entries: ou gain proficiency in {@skill Athletics}, if you are already proficient, you gain expertise.

items.name: Brutal Charge
entries: When you take the {@action Dash} action and end your movement within range of a target with a melee weapon you are holding, you may make the {@action attack} action as part of the same action. If you chose to {@action shove} a creature with the attack action gained as part of a Dash, you may choose to shove the creature up to 10 feet and knock them {@condition prone} with the same shove attack.

items.name: Grappler
entries: You may use a bonus action to grapple an opponent that is {@condition prone}.

items.name: Savage Attack
entries: Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you may roll the weapon's damage dice twice and select the better result. If you are adding additional dice to the damage roll (such as after scoring a critical hit or a sneak attack), those dice are rolled normally. If you select this feature a second time, you may inflict the maximum possible result of the weapon's damage dice rather than rolling.

items.name: Street Fighter
entries: You are proficient with improvised weapons and your unarmed strike uses a {@dice d4} for damage. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple or shove the target.
Creature's you have {@condition grappled} have disadvantage on attack rolls.
If you hold your attack action, you can move up to your speed as part of the reaction.

If you suffer a critical hit, your next weapon attack deals bonus damage equal to your level. If you take this a second time, all your weapon attacks deal bonus damage equal to your leve until the end of your next turn.
If aoo hits triggered by target standing from {@condition prone}, you CAN knock them {@condition prone} again if they are no more than one size category larger than you or smaller
The area in a 10 foot radius around you is considered difficult terrain for creatures of your choice, creatures immune to being {@condition frightened} are not affected by this feature.
You can drag or carry a creature you have {@condition grappled} without reducing your speed as long as the creature is the same size or smaller than you.

items.name: ?? (from Crusher)
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

items.name: ?? (from Crusher)
entries: When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.

items.name: ?? (from Piercer)
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

items.name: ?? (from Piercer)
entries: When you score a critical hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

items.name: ?? (from Poisoner)
entries: When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores resistance to poison damage.

items.name: ?? (from Poisoner)
entries: You can apply poison to a weapon or piece of ammunition as a bonus action, instead of an action.

items.name: ?? (from Slasher)
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed ofthe target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

items.name: ?? (from Slasher)
entries: When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

feat.name: Shadow Touched (Maze Touched)
entries: Your exposure to the Shadowfellâ€™s magic (Materia Unformed Maze) has changed you, granting you a broad array of potential benefits.

items.name: ?? (from Shadow Touched, reworked)
entries: You learn the invisibility spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast it in this way, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

feat.name: Sharp Intellect
entries: Your mind is always working, allowing you to notice the finer details, remember relevant facts, the speech and mannerisms of others, and process your thoughts quickly.

items.name: Arcane Intellect
entries: You understand the nature of magic, allowing you to identify spells when cast by a spellcaster. If you perceive a spell being cast, the spell's effect, or both, you can make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check to identify the spell being cast. The DC equals 15 + the spell's level. If you select this feature a second time, you make the roll with advantage.

items.name: Intuitive Assessment
entries: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to it's Intelligence and Wisdom scores. If you select this feature a second time, you may know precisely the Intelligence and Wisdom scores of an observed creature.

items.name: Lip Reader
entries: If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret what it's saying by reading its lips. In addition, you can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

items.name: Perfect Memory
entries: You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset, and you always know which way is north, you have advantage on any ability checks to avoid getting lost, in addition, you can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month. If you select this feature a second time, your memory becomes so acute you can accurately recall even the most finite details of anything you've seen or heard within the last month to the point that you could duplicate a key or a spellbook that you have observed.

items.name: Versatile Intellect
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom ability check, you may substitute your Intelligence score if it is higher.

items.name: Versatile Intuition
entries: Any time you make an Intelligence ability check, you may substitute your Wisdom score if it is higher.

items.name: Social Whit
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}) check, you may substitute your Intelligence score if it is higher.

When you observe or interact with a creature for 1 minute or more or you spend an action to closely examine it by touch and smell, you can determine if its mood or behavior is being influenced by a spell or other magical effect.

Additionally, if you spend 10 minutes or more speaking with a creature which is influenced by such a spell or effect, that creature can attempt to repeat its saving throw at advantage against that spell or effect. Once it has done so, it can't do so again until it completes a long rest.

items.name: Ventriloquist
entries: Any time you can speak, you can cause your voice to emit from a point up to 30 feet away. If a creature is within 30 feet of you, you can give the impression that sounds you make originate from that creature.
Your ventriloquism isnâ€™t limited to words, but includes any sounds you can make, including imitations of animals and the vocal components of spells.

You can read and cast any spell scroll containing a spell of a level that is equal to half your character level, or lower, regardless if it is on your class list or not. 2 points allows you to create imperfect scrolls that anyone can use as long as they meet the level requirement, but can never be copied into a spellbook or ritual book and cost twice as much time and gold to create.

feat.name: Single Handed Weapon Specialist
entries: You are a master of fighting with one handed melee weapons and versatile weapons. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing these weapons.

items.name: Close Quarters Fighting
entries: After making an attack with the benefit of your proficiency modifier against a creature within 5 feet with a melee weapon you are holding in one hand, you may use your bonus action to make a shove or grapple attack with your free hand.

items.name: Deadly Swing
entries: efore you make an attack roll with a melee weapon with the versatile property you are wielding in one hand, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you select this feature a second time, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your proficiency modifier to the attack roll, adding twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

items.name: Disable
entries: Before you make a melee attack with a weapon that you are proficient with, and you are holding nothing in your other hand, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, the target of the attack suffers disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. If you select this feature a second time, the target of the attack suffers disadvantage on its next two weapon attack rolls it makes before the end of its next turn.

items.name: Extended Reach
entries: When you make an attack roll with a melee weapon with the versatile property and holding nothing in your other hand, you may make a one handed attack as if the weapon had the reach property.

items.name: Nimble Warrior
entries: When you use a melee weapon one handed, and nothing in the other, it is treated as if it had the finesse property.

items.name: Parry
entries: When you are wielding a weapon with which you are proficient and nothing in your other hand, and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. If you select this feature a second time, after you use this feature, you retain a +2 to your AC against melee attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

items.name: Parry Missile
entries: When wielding a melee weapon that lacks the heavy or two handed property, you may use the weapon to attempt to deflect a missile attack. After the attack roll is made, you may use your reaction to add your proficiency modifier to your AC against that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. If you select this feature a second time, after you use this feature, you retain a +2 to your AC against ranged attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in three one handed weapons of your choice.
When you miss with an attack of opportunity when wielding a weapon with which you are proficient and nothing in your other hand, you do not lose your reaction.
Close Quarter Fighting... 2 pointer, lets you make an unarmed strike for 1d4+ str or dex which can be replaced by natural weapons if you have them

feat.name: Skulker
entries: You are an expert at skulking and scouting in dangerous locations, like dungeons, dark hallways in an enemy lair, or caverns.

items.name: Alert Traveller
entries: Traveling at a fast pace doesn't impose the normal âˆ’5 penalty on your passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score.

items.name: Hidden Sniper
entries: When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position. If you select this feature a second time, you may use your reaction to make another hide check if your position is revealed after hitting with a ranged weapon attack.

items.name: Inventive Sneaking
entries: You can try to hide when you are lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.

items.name: See in the Shadows
entries: Dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sight. If you select this feature a second time, you may see in darkness as if you had darkvision (60 feet), or if you already have darkvision, the range is increased by 30 feet.

items.name: Sharp Hearing
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relying on sound.

items.name: Stealthy
entries: You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill, if you already have proficiency, you gain expertise. If you select this feature a second time, moving stealthily does not hamper your movement.

items.name: Trap Avoidance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.

items.name: Trap Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
Just combne Trap Avoidance and Trap Resistance into 1 bullet?

items.name: Tumble
entries: As an action or bonus action, you can tumble through the sapce of a hostile creature to a location on the other side of it. You musthave enough movement to reach the other side to do so.

feat.name: Survivor
entries: You have a knack for surviving the most harrowing of situations, and you have a talent for keeping those in your care alive.

items.name: Combat Medic
entries: When you use a healer's kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

items.name: Doctor
entries: As an action, you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore 1d6 + 4 hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

items.name: Fortunate
entries: You have a luck point. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend the luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend your luck point after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose whether to use your roll or the initial result. You can also spend your luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20, and then choose whether the attack uses the attackerâ€™s roll or yours. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled. You regain your expended luck point when you finish a long rest. You may select this feature more than once.

items.name: Inspiring Leader
entries: You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to Â½ your level (rounded up). A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest. If you select this feature twice, the temporary hit points are equal to your level. If you select this feature three times, the temporary hit points are equal to your level + your Charisma modifier.
Your running long jump and high jump is increased by a number of feet equal to your proficiency bonus.
When you finish a long rest, you regain all spent hit dice.

items.name: Slippery
entries: Whenever you succeed on a saving throw, you can use your reaction to move up to half your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity. 2 pointer no longer requires your reaction, free action.
You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10.
When you succeed a saving throw against a LIST of conditions, your next ability check or attack roll is done at advantage.
When you use your action to dash, disengage or dash you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: ?? (from Chef, combined two)
entries: You gain proficiency with cook's utensils if you don't already have it. Additionally, as part of a short rest, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand. you can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your proficiency bonus. At the end of the short rest, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra 1d8 hit points.

items.name: ?? (from Chef, combined two)
entries: You gain proficiency with cook's utensils if you don't already have it. Additionally, with one hour of work or when you finish a long rest, you can cook a number of treats equal to your proficiency bonus. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a bonus action to eat one of those treats to gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Tactician
entries: In combat you are careful and employ enhanced tactics that make you especially deadly.

items.name: Combat Tactician
entries: You learn a maneuver of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master Archetype in the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). You gain one superiority die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuver. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You may select this feature more than once, each additional selection provides one additional maneuver known and d6 superiority die.

items.name: Disabling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature that is one size category larger or smaller than you with an opportunity attack, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

items.name: Opportunist
entries: When a creature within range of a melee weapon you are holding makes an attack against a target other than you (and that target doesn't have this feat), you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

items.name: Sentinel
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.

When you are {@condition grappled}, you can use your action to reverse the grapple. Make a grapple check against the creature. If you succeed, you are no longer considered {@condition grappled} and the creature that was grappling you becomes {@condition grappled} by you if it is your size or smaller.
When a create within range of a melee weapon you are holding makes an ranged attack roll, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against the attacking creature.
When you take the Dodge action, you can move 5 feet without provoking attack of opportunity

items.name: Lead by Example
entries: After you take an action, as a bonus action, you can select a creature that you can see within 30 feet to inspire to follow suit. If, on their subsequent turn, they take the same action as you, such as attacking the same enemy, or performing the same skill check, they have advantage on any rolls involved with doing so.

items.name: Astute
entries: When you use the Help action to give an ally advantage on an attack roll, you gain the benefits of half cover until the beginning of your next turn if you are within 5 feet of them.

items.name: ?? (from Fighting Initiate)
entries: Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting. As a result, you learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace this feat's fighting style with another one from the fighter class that you don't have.

items.name: ?? (from Poisoner)
entries: You gain proficiency with the poisoner's kit if you don't already have it. With one hour of work using apoisoner's kit and expending 50gp worth of materials, you can create a number of doses of potent poison equal to your proficiency bonus. Once applied to a weapon or piece of ammunition, this poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until you hit with the weapon or ammunition. When a creature takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Tough as Nails
entries: You are especially hardy, you are wounded less and irrepressible even when wounded, recovering with surprising speed.

items.name: Durable
entries: When you spend Hit Dice to recover Hit Points, instead of rolling, you heal the maximum possible result. For example, if a Cleric (d8) spends 2 Hit Dice on healing, they automatically regain 16 Hit Points plus their modifier for Con on both dice.

items.name: Hardy
entries: You do not suffer {@condition exhaustion} when you fall to 0 Hit Points. If you select this feature a second time, you may recover up to two levels of {@condition exhaustion} on a long rest.

items.name: Resilient
entries: You gain proficiency in saving throws in the ability score of your choice.

items.name: Tenacious
entries: Your Hit Point maximum cannot be lowered.

items.name: Tough
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level when you select this feature. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional one hit point. You may select this feature twice, if you do so, you gain twice the benefit.

items.name: Rugged
entries: Whenever you succeed on a saving throw against a spell or effect that deals damage, you can use your reaction to spend 1 hit dice and recover some hit points. 2 pointer no longer requires your reaction, free action.

If you take damage from an attack roll or as a result to a saving throw, you may use you reaction to reduce the damage by an amount equal to your character level. You can do this once per long rest. 2 pointer to short rest.

items.name: Leathery Skin
entries: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and stil gain this benefit.

feat.name: Two Handed Weapon Specialist
entries: You are a master of fighting with a weapon held in two hands. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing a weapon this way.

items.name: Ferocious Strike
entries: Before you make an attack roll with a melee weapon you are holding with two hands, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add twice your proficiency modifier to the damage. If you select this feature a second time, you may choose to forgo any amount up to your proficiency modifier to the attack roll, adding twice the amount of the penalty to the damage.

items.name: Merciless
entries: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a weapon held in two hands or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can immediately make one more melee weapon attack using your bonus action. If you select this option a second time, you may make the additional attack without using your bonus action. You may only benefit from Merciless once on your turn.

items.name: Pommel Strike
entries: When you take the attack action and make all attacks with a melee weapon you are holding in two hands with the benefit of your proficiency modifier, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with another part of the weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary attack. The weaponâ€™s damage die for this attack is a d4, and it deals bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Readied Weapon
entries: While you are wielding a reach weapon you are holding in two hands, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter your reach. The weapon that provoked the attack must be used to make the attack in order to use this feature.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in three weapons with the two handed or versatile property.

feat.name: Weapon and Shield Specialist
entries: You are a master of fighting with a weapon and shield. Your specialized training has provided you with certain advantages when employing weapon combat while you have a shield equipped.

items.name: Defensive Fighting
entries: Before you make a melee attack with a weapon that you are holding while wielding a shield in your other hand, you can choose to forgo your proficiency modifier to the attack roll. If the attack hits, the target of the attack has disadvantage on any attack rolls against you until the beginning of your next turn.

items.name: Firm Grip
entries: You ignore the strength requirement to wield any shield or buckler.

items.name: Shield Bash
entries: You are proficient in the use of a shield as an improvised weapon, the shield has the light property and inflicts 1d4 bludgeoning damage on a successful hit. If you select this option a second time, a magical shield is considered a magical weapon for the purposes of overcoming resistance to bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Shielded Position
entries: If you are not {@condition incapacitated}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets you, and if that effect would inflict half damage on a successful saving throw, you can use your reaction to take no damage instead if you succeed on the saving throw. If you select this option a second time, you take only half damage if you fail the saving throw.

items.name: Shield Shove
entries: You can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield. If you select this option a second time, you may, with a successful shove, both push the creature 5 feet and knock them {@condition prone}.

items.name: Rapid Ready
entries: You may equip or stow a shield with the same interact with an object you use to equip or stow a weapon. If you select this option a second time, you may stow a previously held weapon with the same interact with an object.

items.name: Weapon Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in three one handed weapons of your choice.
You provide half cover to creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you while you wield a shield.
